## Eukrohnia hamata
Length data from multi-net measurements by professional. Selected data from Stations 7-17 and < 100 m.

```{r}
chaeto_dist = fitdist(x_Eukrohniahamata, "lnorm")

plot(chaeto_dist)
summary(chaeto_dist)
```


## Euphausiacea furcilia
Length data from multi-net measurements by professional. Selected data from Stations 7-17 and < 100 m.

```{r}
krill_dist = fitdist(x_Euphausiaceafurcilia, "gamma")

plot(krill_dist)
summary(krill_dist)
```

## Themisto Abuysorum
My measurements are from 3 stations. Gamma distributions ok for most measurements. Not very representative for the larger individuals. I was not able to identify smaller species so I likely only measured the larger ones... i think too much bias to use my data. 
I combined my data with the multi-net measurements done by a professional. The data from the multinet has avoidance issues and is likely biased.

There is also Themisto abyssorum length data available from the Pelagic Trawl document but the lengths are < 1mm and do not agree at all with my or the professionals measurements. I do not use these.

```{r}
amphi_dist = fitdist(x_Themistoabyssorum, "gamma")

plot(amphi_dist)
summary(amphi_dist)
```

## Thyssanoessa inermis
Measurements from Pelagic Trawl length measurements spreadsheet, *Who did these measurements*
A log ormal distribution is the best fit I have found

```{r}
KrillBig_dist = fitdist(x_Thyssanoessainermis, "lnorm")

plot(KrillBig_dist)
summary(KrillBig_dist)
```
